required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of IM19 CAR-T Cells in Patients With Relapsed and Refractory (R/R) Mantle Cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1-2 Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of IM19 CAR-T Cells in Patients With Relapsed and Refractory (R/R) Mantle Cell Lymphoma

lead_sponsor.agency: Beijing Immunochina Medical Science & Technology Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: Beijing Immunochina Medical Science & Technology Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase I/II, open-label, multicenter study to assess the efficacy and safety of IM19 CAR-T cells in adult R/R Mantle Cell Lymphoma subjects

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events (AEs) and abnormal laboratory test results as assessed by CTCAE V5.0
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days after IM19 CAR-T cell infusion
At 3 months after IM19 CAR-T cell infusion
primary_outcome.description: ORR, defined as the proportion of participants with a complete response or partial response, as determined by the investigator according to Lugano(2014)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 28 days and 6 months after IM19 CAR-T cell infusion
secondary_outcome.description: ORR, defined as the proportion of participants with a complete response or partial response, as determined by the investigator according to Lugano(2014)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after IM19 CAR-T cell infusion
secondary_outcome.description: PFS, defined as the time from CAR-T cell infusion to the first occurrence of disease progression or death from any cause (whichever occurs first) , as determined by the investigator according to Lugano(2014)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after IM19 CAR-T cell infusion
secondary_outcome.description: DOR, defined as the time from the first occurrence of a documented objective response to disease progression or death from any cause (whichever occurs first) in Stage 1, as determined by the investigator according to Lugano(2014)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after CAR-T cell infusion
secondary_outcome.description: OS , defined as the time from IM19 CAR-T cell infusion to death from any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistence of CAR-T cells (cell counts and cell percentage in peripheral blood)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after IM19 CAR-T cell infusion
secondary_outcome.description: The persistence over time of CAR T cells in the peripheral blood as determined by flow cytometry and qPCR

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after IM19 CAR-T cell infusion

intervention.description: IM19 CAR-T cells will be administered at dose level: 100×10^6 CAR-T cells or 200×10^6 CAR-T cells
